intro: Diplodium actites, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. Diplodium actites is typically found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils. It is a low-growing perennial that often forms dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization in its habitat.
